entry.title: Anime fans stumbled upon a mathematical proof
Maybe don’t use custom properties in shorthand properties
entry.summary: This easily qualifies as a "gotcha" in CSS and is a good reminder that the cascade doesn't know everything all at the same time. If a custom property is invalid, the cascade won't ignore it, and it gets evaluated, which invalidates the declaration. Maybe don’t use custom properties in shorthand properties originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.

entry.title: The Anthropic Economic Index
Organizing Design System Component Patterns With CSS Cascade Layers
entry.summary: I enjoy organizing code and find cascade layers a fantastic way to organize code explicitly as the cascade looks at it. The neat part is, that as much as it helps with "top-level" organization, cascade layers can be nested, which allows us to author more precise styles based on the cascade and inheritance.
